title._content: Gum vendors still selling, near the National Theater, 04/11/1912

description._content: Original Caption: 9 P.M. Gum vendors still selling, near the National Theater. Eli Marks, 8 years old, makes 25 cents a night. Morris Marks, 10 years old, makes 50 cents a night. Harry Schneider, 11 years old, makes 50 cents a night. "When they see us, they chase us home at 8:30, but when we see 'em coming we slid the boxes in our pockets, until the cop gets past. Then we stay 'til 9 or after sometimes.", 04/11/1912 U.S. National Archives’ Local Identifier: NWL-233-PACCBILL-63AD5-2 ARC ID: 306615 Photographer: Hine, Lewis Created By: U.S. House of Representatives. (03/04/1789 - ) From: Record Group/Collection: 233 From: Papers Accompanying Specific Bills and Resolutions of the 63rd Congress Committee on the District of Columbia, 04/07/1913 - 03/03/1915 Series Dates: 1913-1915 Production Dates: 04/11/1912 Persistent URL: arcweb.archives.gov/arc/action/ExternalIdSearch?id=306615 Repository Contact Information: Center for Legislative Archives (NWL), National Archives Building Reproductions may be ordered via an independent vendor. NARA maintains a list of vendors at www.archives.gov/research/order/vendors-photos-maps-dc.html Access Restrictions: Unrestricted Use Restrictions: Unrestricted
